criteria: Application of the Addition Rule in Problem Solving
descriptions: Does not demonstrate understanding of the Addition Rule formula P(A or B) = P(A) + P(B) - P(A and B).
Shows limited understanding of the formula; may confuse the components or misapply it.
Demonstrates partial understanding of the formula but struggles to apply it correctly in all cases.
Understands the formula and can apply it in simple scenarios, but may have difficulty with more complex problems.
Demonstrates a strong understanding of the formula and can apply it accurately in most scenarios.
Demonstrates a comprehensive understanding of the formula and applies it flawlessly, even in complex and novel scenarios.
Unable to apply the Addition Rule to solve probability problems.
Attempts to apply the rule but makes significant errors in calculation or interpretation.
Applies the rule with some errors, particularly in identifying the correct probabilities to include in the formula.
Applies the rule correctly in straightforward problems but struggles with problems that require rearranging the formula or interpreting the results in context.
Applies the rule effectively in a variety of problems, showing a good understanding of how to manipulate and interpret the formula.
Demonstrates mastery in applying the Addition Rule to solve complex and non-routine problems, and can explain the reasoning clearly.
Unable to interpret the result of the Addition Rule in the context of the problem.
Provides a superficial interpretation that does not fully explain the meaning of the probability in the given context.
Interprets the result with some inaccuracies or limitations, failing to fully connect the probability to the real-world scenario.
Provides a reasonable interpretation of the result in context, but may lack depth or clarity.
Offers a clear and insightful interpretation of the result, explaining its implications in the context of the problem.
Provides a thorough and nuanced interpretation, demonstrating a deep understanding of the probability and its significance in the context of the problem.
